Description: Rim and floor sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery plate; orange clay with silver mica; flat base and vertical, outcurving rim. Interior: cream slip; sets of four verticals on top of lip; band with added red band lined in white at outer edge of floor; inside, part of a wild goat and of a lion with raised paw, both to left; filling ornament: rosettes with scanty incision; red patch on neck of lion and on haunch and lower belly of wild goat; on outer face of lip broad band; reserved underside with three grooves near edge of resting surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.751)
